item.title: 西南航空公司将开始试飞首架装有辅助驾驶舱屏障的飞机
item.description: 美国西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）表示，该公司将于本周五开始试飞其首架在飞行甲板上安装了用于防止入侵的辅助屏障的飞机。【原文：Southwest Airlines said it will begin on Friday flying its first jet with a secondary barrier to the flight deck designed to prevent intrusions.】

item.title: 消息人士称花旗证券第二季度交易收入下滑
item.description: 一位熟悉 Citadel Securities 财报的消息人士称，由于波动性减弱，该公司第二季度的交易和做市收入下滑了 8.4%。【原文：Citadel Securities' revenue from trading and market-making slid 8.4% in the second quarter as volatility ebbed, according a source familiar with the company's results.】

item.title: 沃尔玛击败股东对阿片类药物调查披露的诉讼
item.description: 沃尔玛击败了股东们的上诉，股东们称这家全球最大的零售商没有披露联邦检察官正在调查其阿片类药物配药行为，从而欺骗了他们。【原文：Walmart defeated an appeal by shareholders who said the world's largest retailer defrauded them by failing to disclose that federal prosecutors were investigating its opioid-dispensing practices.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，谷歌将在广告技术调查中面临适度的欧盟反垄断罚款
item.description: 三位直接知情人士透露，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌将在未来几周内面临欧盟的适度反垄断罚款，原因是其广告技术业务涉嫌存在反竞争行为。【原文：Alphabet's Google is set to face a modest EU antitrust fine in the coming weeks for allegedly anti-competitive practices in its adtech business, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，卡夫亨氏接近达成分拆协议
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，卡夫亨氏正在接近一项自我解体计划。【原文：Kraft Heinz is closing in on a plan to break itself up, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.】

item.title: 马斯克的 xAI 公司起诉工程师，指控其向 OpenAI 窃取机密
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司xAI起诉了该公司的一名前工程师，指控其窃取了与Grok聊天机器人有关的商业机密，并将这些机密提供给了竞争对手OpenAI。【原文：Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI has sued a former engineer at the company for allegedly stealing trade secrets related to its Grok chatbot and taking them to rival OpenAI.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西下月推出数据中心激励措施，以吸引大型科技公司
item.description: 两位经济政策官员告诉路透社，巴西计划在 9 月初宣布一项税收激励计划，旨在吸引外国科技公司在该国建设数据中心。【原文：Brazil plans to announce a tax incentive plan in early September aimed at attracting foreign tech companies to build data centers in the country, two economic policy officials told Reuters.】

item.title: 超微股价在人工智能服务器制造商公布财务控制问题后下跌
item.description: 在这家人工智能优化服务器制造商重申财务报告内部控制存在薄弱环节之后，超微计算机公司的股价周五下跌了近 5%。【原文：Super Micro Computer's shares fell nearly 5% on Friday after the artificial intelligence-optimized server maker reiterated weaknesses in internal control over financial reporting.】

item.title: 奥地利下任央行行长：比前任温和，曾斥责特朗普政府
item.description: 奥地利下一任央行行长是行为经济学家马丁-科切尔（Martin Kocher），尽管他曾因央行独立性受到威胁而斥责特朗普政府，但预计他在公开场合会比其直言不讳的前任温和一些。【原文：Austria's next central bank governor, behavioural economist Martin Kocher, is expected to be milder in public than his outspoken predecessor, although he has rebuked the Trump administration over threats to central bank independence.】

item.title: 美联储资产负债表缩减进入新阶段，反向回购资金基本耗尽
item.description: 美联储缩减资产负债表规模的努力正步入一个更加不确定的阶段，因为流动性过剩的一个关键代表几乎已经消失殆尽。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s effort to shrink the size of its balance sheet is moving into a more uncertain phase as a key proxy of excess liquidity has been very nearly extinguished.】

item.title: 为寻求更多权力，特朗普利用解雇来测试总统的极限
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）正在推动对联邦政府及其机构所做的一切进行更多的控制，而一连串的解雇事件将考验他能在多大程度上实现自己的追求。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is pushing for more control over everything the federal government and its agencies do, and a string of firings will test how far he might be able to take his quest.】

item.title: 金吉达将重返巴拿马，投资 3000 万美元，提供 5000 个工作岗位
item.description: 巴拿马政府和香蕉巨头金吉达公司周五表示，在今年早些时候大规模裁员之后，该公司已同意重新启动在巴拿马的业务。【原文：Banana giant Chiquita has agreed to restart operations in Panama after mass layoffs earlier this year, Panama's government and the company said on Friday.】

item.title: 法国和德国拒绝接受特朗普对欧盟科技立法的威胁
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普批评欧洲的数字服务规则之后，法国和德国周五捍卫了欧洲通过自己的技术立法的权利，称美国的任何胁迫都将遭到报复。【原文：France and Germany on Friday defended Europe's right to adopt its own legislation on technology after U.S. President Donald Trump criticised European rules on digital services, saying any U.S. coercion would be met with retaliation.】

item.title: EIA 称美国 6 月石油产量创历史新高
item.description: 美国能源信息署周五称，6月份美国原油产量创下历史新高，日产量增加13.3万桶，达到1358万桶/日。【原文：U.S. crude oil production hit a record high in June, the Energy Information Administration said on Friday, rising 133,000 barrels per day to 13.58 million bpd.】

item.title: 特朗普绕过国会，罕见地永久取消拨款
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统已采取行动，单方面取消国会授权的 49 亿美元联邦资金，使关于谁控制国家支出的争论升级。【原文：President Donald Trump has moved to unilaterally cancel $4.9 billion in federal funding authorized by Congress, escalating the fight over who controls the nation's spending.】

item.title: 微量豁免终止，全球邮政服务暂停部分美国货运
item.description: 美国已永久终止 "微量 "免税政策，该政策允许价值 800 美元以下的物品免税进口。唐纳德-特朗普总统曾发布行政命令，称这一豁免是逃避关税和贩毒的漏洞。【原文：The United States has permanently ended the "de minimis" exemption, which allowed items valued under $800 to be imported duty-free. This change, effective from Friday, follows President Donald Trump's executive order citing the exemption as a loophole for tariff evasion and drug trafficking.】

item.title: Archer-Daniels-Midland 将停止布什内尔工厂的运营
item.description: 谷物贸易商 Archer-Daniels-Midland 周五表示，作为其精简大豆蛋白生产网络计划的一部分，该公司计划停止在伊利诺伊州布什内尔工厂的运营。【原文：Grain trader Archer-Daniels-Midland said on Friday it plans to cease operations at its plant in Bushnell, Illinois, as part of its plan to streamline its soy protein production network.】

item.title: 受美联储独立风险影响，美国股票基金仅吸引了少量资金流入
item.description: 截至8月27日的一周内，美国股票基金仅吸引了少量资金流入，原因是在唐纳德-特朗普总统试图解雇央行行长后，美联储独立性面临的风险抑制了投资者的需求。【原文：U.S. equity funds drew only marginal inflows in the week through August 27 as risks to the Federal Reserve's independence kept investor demand in check after President Donald Trump attempted to fire a central bank governor.】

item.title: 经过一年的努力，伍德集团有条件接受 Sidara 的收购要约
item.description: 伍德集团与总部位于迪拜的 Sidara 公司周五表示，伍德集团已经有条件地同意了 Sidara 的收购要约，从而结束了长达一年多、涉及多次要约和拒绝的收购过程。【原文：Wood Group has conditionally agreed to a takeover bid from Dubai-based Sidara, the companies said on Friday, ending a pursuit that spanned more than a year and involved multiple offers and rejections.】

item.title: 麦高夫离职，汇丰任命内部人士亨德森为美国临时首席执行官
item.description: 汇丰银行美国首席执行官丽莎-麦格夫（Lisa McGeough）在上任数月后辞职，该行在寻找继任者的同时，任命长期高管杰森-亨德森（Jason Henderson）担任临时主管。【原文：HSBC's U.S. CEO Lisa McGeough stepped down months after taking the job and the bank tapped longtime executive Jason Henderson as interim head while it looks for a successor.】

item.title: 美国将加大英特尔、SK 海力士和三星在华生产芯片的难度
item.description: 根据《联邦公报》，美国将取消三星、SK 海力士和英特尔在中国接收美国半导体制造设备的许可，从而使全球芯片制造商更难在中国生产芯片。【原文：The U.S. will make it more difficult for global chipmakers Samsung , SK Hynix and Intel to produce chips in China by revoking permission for the companies to receive American semiconductor manufacturing equipment there, according to the Federal Register.】

item.title: 即时观点：美国核心 PCE 略有增长，但符合预期
item.description: 美国商务部周五称，7月份个人消费支出价格指数（PCE）上涨0.2%，而6月份的涨幅为0.3%，未作修正，与路透社调查的经济学家的预期一致。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said on Friday its Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index (PCE) rose 0.2% in July, versus the unrevised 0.3% rise in June and matched the estimate of economists polled by Reuters.】

item.title: PayPal 称正在与德国银行合作处理大面积支付中断事件
item.description: PayPal 周五表示，在德国发生大面积中断用户支付事件后，该公司正在努力解决任何遗留问题，这引起了人们对该应用在线交易可靠性的担忧。【原文：PayPal said on Friday that it was working to resolve any remaining issues following a widespread disruption that had halted user payments in Germany, raising alarm over the reliability of the app for online transactions.】

item.title: 文件显示，贝莱德持有的意大利电信股份已超过 5%。
item.description: 路透社周五看到的一份监管文件显示，全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）已将其在意大利电信（TIM）的持股比例提高到 5.1%。【原文：The world's largest asset manager BlackRock has raised its stake in Telecom Italia (TIM) to 5.1%, a regulatory document seen by Reuters showed on Friday.】

item.title: 美国 7 月商品贸易逆差大幅扩大
item.description: 由于进口激增，7 月份美国货物贸易逆差急剧扩大，这表明贸易可能成为拖累第三季度经济增长的主要因素。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit in goods widened sharply in July as imports surged, suggesting trade could be a major drag on economic growth in the third quarter.】

item.title: 美国公布 7 月消费者支出稳健；核心通胀走强
item.description: 7 月份，美国消费者支出稳健增长，同时，由于进口关税提高了部分商品的价格，基本通胀率有所回升，但在劳动力市场状况疲软的背景下，这些数据可能无法阻止美联储下月降息。【原文：U.S. consumer spending increased solidly in July while underlying inflation picked up as tariffs on imports raised prices of some goods, but that data will probably not prevent the Federal Reserve from cutting interest rates next month against the backdrop of softening labor market conditions.】

item.title: 对美联储独立性的担忧导致全球股票基金流入减少
item.description: 在截至8月27日的一周内，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）试图解雇一名美联储理事，人们对美联储的独立性感到担忧，全球股票基金的需求出现下滑。【原文：Global equity funds witnessed a dip in demand in the week through August 27 on concerns around the Federal Reserve's independence as President Donald Trump attempted to fire a Federal Reserve governor.】

item.title: 埃及围捕青少年 TikTokkers，打击社交媒体
item.description: 埃及当局一直在围捕拥有数百万粉丝的青少年 TikTokkers，最近几周拘留了数十人，指控罪名从违反家庭价值观到洗钱不等。【原文：Egyptian authorities have been rounding up teenaged TikTokkers with millions of followers, detaining dozens in recent weeks on accusations ranging from violating family values to laundering money.】

item.title: 西班牙政府因使用华为设备取消与西班牙电信的合同
item.description: 西班牙数字转型部表示，西班牙政府已经取消了与西班牙电信公司（Telefonica）签订的光纤服务合同，原因是该公司使用了中国华为公司生产的设备，因为欧洲担心此类设备可能会带来安全风险。【原文：The Spanish government has cancelled a fiber-optic service contract with Telefonica over the use of equipment made by China's Huawei amid concerns in Europe that such gear may pose a security risk, the Digital Transformation Ministry said.】

item.title: 由于价格战的影响，比亚迪的季度利润在三年半以来首次下降
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪的季度利润出现了三年多来的首次下滑，因为在政府打击价格战的运动中，比亚迪的扩张遇到了障碍。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD's quarterly profit fell for the first time in more than three years, as its expansion hit a speed bump amid a government campaign against price wars.】
